user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
Not only is the Convertible Color the best cream blush formula, it is hands down the best blush ever, period. It has the perfect amount of dewiness with the perfect amount of pigment and I just can't get enough. I've tried cream blushes from what seems like every other brand and I just keep going back to Stila. My favourite shades are Lillium and Peony. Peony is the perfect neutral for my fair skin tone, when neutrals usually pull too warm/brown on me, making my skin look ruddy. I've tried to apply this blush with fingers, brushes, and beauty sponges, but using my fingers works the best for me. After decluttering and downsizing my makeup collection to try to live more minimally in 2020, this is the only blush that made the cut. It's that good and I really can't recommend this product enough.

review_content:
I have very fair skin, and the shade Magnolia wasn't exactly recommended for someone as pale as I am, but I know how to make a cream product work for me. Use your fingers, let it warm up to your skin, then it should blend out nicely. Use a sponge after you've patted it out with your fingers if you put too much on. Simple. This shade is so lovely with my neutral undertones, and as long as your skin has neutral undertones like mine, it can work on a lot of different skin tones. I share this with my gf who has medium skin, and it looks even better on her.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Green']
review_content:
We've been really into cream blushes lately and wanted to explore more hyped options. After some research we found that these Stila blushes have a cult following. We got the shade Camellia and it is absolutely beautiful. We would say it's an orangey brown shade that is deep enough to add some definition to our cheeks (on our skin tone). It leaves a beautiful sheen but does not stay sticky (something we hate about some cream blushes). We always apply with our fingers and that method seems to work best for blending purposes. The color doesn't last all day, we'd say 5-7 hours. The only other downside is the packaging, it felt extremely cheap and it was a lot smaller than expected. Overall, we'd highly recommend these and will be getting more shades!

review_title: Wonder Woman made me buy it
review_content: I saw this product (Shade Lillium) mentioned by Gal's make-up artist for the movie so I figured I would give it a try. I was really impressed by this product. I don't apply with a brush, but with my fingers and it blends into a really beautiful peachy tone on the cheeks. I tend to like more natural blushes without any glitters in them so it won't clash with the highlight I choose.

Life changing product. Bought "Lillium" - which is more pinky in person. Looks dewy and amazing on cheeks and gives lips the perfect nude hue. It's pigmented, so you don't need a lot. And it lasts ALL DAY - rare for cream blush. This product is now a staple for me and makes on-the-go makeup way easier. Obsessed.

user_specs: ['Age 13-17', 'Skin Type Oily', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content: This blush is amazing for everyday where when used with a light hand. But BEWARE GOING IN WITH A BRUSH! i did this and there was a streak of color on my face! use either with fingers, or with a lighter hand.

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Oily', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Eye Color Brown']
review_content:
I used to be very skeptical about non-powder blushes, but I am really happy that I gave this product a try and now this is my daily go-to blush. I got it in Lillium after watching a makeup tutorial video, and it's a very standard pink color that'll look good on everyone. I have pretty tan skin, so the super bright blushes don't really show on my skin, but Lillium is perfect. I also love the texture, since it leaves my skin looking dewy and glowy. I am into japanese igari makeup at the moment, so I always use this on my cheeks just beneath my eyes and it gives me that youthful, young, innocent girl look. It's perfect!

I switched to cream (or serum, gel---anything but powder) blusher a few years ago and will never look back. I tried Lillium and love this stuff. I haven't tried any of the other colors yet, but the formula of this is everything a cream blush should be

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Combination', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content: this is a cream blush i go back to over and over again. in the warmer weather months or for vacationing, i like to use products i can easily melt into the skin and look fresh without feeling sticky. while this blush doesnt set entirely, i dont find it as heavy as the mac cream blushes. not my preference for the lips, it can feel drying

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Hazel']
review_content: This is a review for using this as a blush only. I purchased this in Lillium, which is the most gorgeous shade of blush I've ever owned. It's a lovely, natural looking pink that makes me appear healthy, but not flushed like I just ran a marathon. It applies like a dream with my fingers, never streaks, and is long-lasting. A friend told me that my skin looks so healthy, and it does...as long as I'm wearing this blush!

review_title: natural, beautiful color - easy to apply!
review_content: I purchased this blush in Lillium and can't get enough! This blush easily blends and last all day. If you're looking for a pigmented cream blush that looks natural but has staying power - this is it. Looks great if blended with a beauty blender or your fingers!

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Eye Color Green']
review_content: My convertible blush is great, it's super easy to apply and using your fingertips is the best tool to blend and build color. It's natural but gives your cheeks that perfect flushed look all day.
The sweet pea colour really brings out the sweetness of being a female. Freaking love it!

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Green']
review_content: At 65 i am very careful to apply anything that contains glitter or a lot of shimmer onto my face.I ordered the colors Peony and Petunia and to my surprise Petunia blended beautifully on my very pale skin.Peony might work better in the summer months as it was a bit darker.The colors are matte sheer and natural looking, blended with fingertips or with a stipple brush.Will purchase again!
I don't like Stila cosmetics, but I would buy this blush in Peony again. Great finish and blends like a dream. I never use it on my lips.

I use peony and it offers just the right amount of flush. It's really hard to overdo this one which I love. I have oily, acne-prone skin and I have no problem with this product building up or causing breakouts. It sets just right and no other product compares. I've tried them all.

user_specs: ['Age 35-44', 'Skin Type Normal', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Blue']
review_content:
I have to leave a glowing review for this product. I have been using Stila's Convertible Color for at least 15 years and it never disappoints. I have Camellia, Petunia, Poppy and Fuchsia. It takes very little product to give the perfect flush of color and easy to layer if you need more - it is lasting and so natural looking it's hard to believe. Whenever I stray and try other blush products, I always come back to this and remember why I've loved it for such a long time. When I wear Petunia I get tons of compliments because of how nice it makes my skin look. Other products come and go, but this one is a classic - have purchased this again and again and will continue to do so as long as this is made.

I love Stilla's Convertible Color Dual, it goes on smoothly and the color looks great on my skin tone!

user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Skin Type Oily', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Eye Color Blue']
review_content:
I bought Petunia, and use it as a creamy blush, and WOW this stuff is amazing! It just makes my skin look so youthful and bright. A little goes a long way, and I love that I can use it on my lips as well for an even cuter, subtle look (however I only do that once in a while, since it doesn't last very long on my lips, maybe an hour, before I need more or my lips start to chap). I was almost ready to pay a crazy amount for the Tom Ford creamy blush, since NO ONE is selling creamy blushes anymore for some reason, but I'm really glad a Sephora employee showed me this, because it's the best!
